items.label: 539f6c69ec4f024411eca99f
items.name: Schedule 1 - Residential Rate Three Phase
items.description:
(1)

This schedule is applicable to residential customers for all domestic use, including water heating, space heating and single-phase motors not in excess of seven and one-half horsepower individual capacity, in single private dwellings and their appurtenances, including clubs and fraternities occupying a private dwelling where the occupants share the expense thereof on a nonprofit basis.

(2)

Where a portion of a dwelling is regularly used for business purposes, the energy consumed in that portion so used will be separately metered and billed at the applicable commercial rates. In the event that separate circuits are not provided by the customer, the entire premises shall be classified as nonresidential and billed accordingly. The residential rate shall not apply to service to institutions such as recognized rooming houses and boarding houses operated for profit, the space in an apartment or other residential buildings primarily used as an office or studio for professional or other gainful purposes.
